snippet: Lewis A. Fidler, the front-runner in a race to replace former state senator Carl Kruger, accused his opponent, David Storobin, of having neo-Nazi ties.
abstract: New York City Councilman Lewis A Fidler of Brooklyn, front-runner in a race to replace former New York State Senator Carl Kruger, accuses opponent David Storobin of having neo-Nazi ties; Storobin denies charges; fact that both candidates are Jewish, and running for election in a district in southern Brooklyn that is heavily Jewish, illuminates a level of political mudslinging that many area residents find puzzling.
lead_paragraph: Lewis A. Fidler, the front-runner in a race to replace former state senator Carl Kruger, accused his opponent, David Storobin, of having neo-Nazi ties.

headline.seo: In Brooklyn, Senate Race Between Fidler and Storobin Takes a Nasty Turn
headline.main: In Brooklyn, Senate Race Veers Onto Bitter Ground
headline.print_headline: In Brooklyn, Senate Race Veers Onto Bitter Ground
